MajorClaims.MC1: it is unwise to smoke in a restaurant as well as other public places, and relevant state laws should be codified to strictly prohibit it
MajorClaims.MC2: smoking should be prohibited in restaurants as well as other public places, and that we should support states laws to ban it

Claims.C1: smoking in a restaurant is a harmful and disrespectable behavior
Claims.C2: smoking not only damages the restaurant's environment, but also imposes a potential threat on others' health
Claims.C3: smoking in restaurants should be strictly banned
Claims.C4: the disgusting smoke will severely affect their appetite, or, in other words, spoil their meals and make them an unpleasant experience
Claims.C5: smoking does no good to the smoker himself

Premises.P1: It spoils the smoker's reputation and threats other people's health
Premises.P2: the second-hand smoke, which comes from the smoker's mouth, puts an even greater threat on surrounding people's health than the smoker himself
Premises.P3: it makes the restaurant a polluted place which threatens every customer's health
Premises.P4: if there is only one person smoking in a restaurant, all others will smoke unconsciously and their health is under attacked
Premises.P5: some burned substance in a cigarette can easily deteriorate a person's respiratory system after he/she inhales it
Premises.P6: it is too strong to assert that smoking should be prohibited everywhere in the society, one smoking in a restaurant is considered to enjoy his time with the ignorance of others' health
Premises.P7: The smoke exhaled from the smoker often makes other people feel uncomfortable or disgusted, thus affecting their mood in having their meals
Premises.P8: This, on the other hand, can indirectly decrease the restaurants' popularity
Premises.P9: fewer people are willing to consume there due to their unpleasant experiences
Premises.P10: Not only does it aggravate his health, making him more subject to respiratory diseases, but also it damages his public image and reputation
Premises.P11: most people see smoking in restaurants as an impolite human behavior
Premises.P12: This is especially true when the smoker is a popular political figure or an entertainmening celebrity
Premises.P13: the public are likely to believe that the smoker lacks basic civility and should not be encouraged to be a public leader
